We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;IT Support Officer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Description


	Provide first-level support to end-users for hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computer systems, printers, and other IT equipment.
	Respond to support requests and incidents via email, phone, or ticketing system.
	Troubleshoot system and network problems, diagnosing and solving hardware/software faults.
	Set up user accounts, permissions, and passwords in accordance with company policies.
	Assist in IT asset tracking and ensure accurate inventory management.
	Maintain documentation of IT processes, procedures, and knowledge base articles.
	Escalate unresolved issues to senior IT personnel when required.
	Support IT project rollouts and upgrades under the supervision of senior IT staff.
	Ensure compliance with IT policies and data protection protocols.
	Collaborate with other IT team members to identify recurring issues and opportunities for process improvements.
	Keep abreast of new technologies and best practices in IT support and service delivery.
	Contribute to the development and maintenance of IT documentation, knowledge base articles, and user guides.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field preferred.
	Proven experience in a technical support role, preferably in an IT service desk environment.
	Strong knowledge of IT fundamentals, including operating systems (Windows, macOS), hardware components, networking concepts, and software applications.
	Experience with IT service management tools.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.
	Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with a customer-oriented approach.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize workload, and work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us?


	Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team.
	Work on exciting and challenging projects with the latest technologies.
	Flexible work environment.
	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	If you are passionate about clean code, testing, and scalable architectures, we&rsquo;d love to hear from you! Apply now and be part of a team that values quality and innovation.

IT Support Officer Job at Filmhouse Cinemas Limited




        
    

        
        Filmhouse Cinemas Limited is a dynamic film exhibition company. Our expertise are in the areas of: Cinema operations, management of sites, Ownership of sites, Consultancy for cinema development, Design Fit-out; Cinema project management, Film Distribution: Rights Acquisition, Booking into cinemas, and content development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer 

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	Provide first-level support to end-users for hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computer systems, printers, and other IT equipment.
	Respond to support requests and incidents via email, phone, or ticketing system.
	Troubleshoot system and network problems, diagnosing and solving hardware/software faults.
	Set up user accounts, permissions, and passwords in accordance with company policies.
	Assist in IT asset tracking and ensure accurate inventory management.
	Maintain documentation of IT processes, procedures, and knowledge base articles.
	Escalate unresolved issues to senior IT personnel when required.
	Support IT project rollouts and upgrades under the supervision of senior IT staff.
	Ensure compliance with IT policies and data protection protocols.
	Collaborate with other IT team members to identify recurring issues and opportunities for process improvements.
	Keep abreast of new technologies and best practices in IT support and service delivery.
	Contribute to the development and maintenance of IT documentation, knowledge base articles, and user guides.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field preferred.
	Proven experience in a technical support role, preferably in an IT service desk environment.
	Strong knowledge of IT fundamentals, including operating systems (Windows, macOS), hardware components, networking concepts, and software applications.
	Experience with IT service management tools.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues independently.
	Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with a customer-oriented approach.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize workload, and work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us?


	Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team.
	Work on exciting and challenging projects with the latest technologies.
	Flexible work environment.
	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	If you are passionate about clean code, testing, and scalable architectures, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and be part of a team that values quality and innovation.

Human Resource Analyst Job at Brooks Advisory Services Limited




        
    

        
        Brooks Advisory Services Limited (BASL) is a Management Consulting firm dedicated to providing Human Resource services to SMEs across Africa. We are committed to embedding ourselves in our clients' businesses to deliver essential HR solutions that foster an efficient and effective work environment. Our team consists of experienced mid-level HR professionals equipped with the expertise to implement our solutions effectively, supporting business growth across various industries.

Our clients focus on Business Development, while Brooks Advisory Services Limited (BASL) handles Internal Development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Analyst
     

            
    



Job Location: Garki, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are recruiting a Human Resource Analyst for a restaurant in Abuja.
	The successful candidate will work on-site as the dedicated HR personnel for the restaurant, while working with Brooks Advisory Services Limited (BASL) to implement structured HR processes, policies, and performance systems.
	This role is suited for an HR professional who is detail-oriented, operationally sound, and data-driven, with a strong understanding of people operations within a hospitality or service-based environment.


Key Responsibilities
HR Operations & Data Management:


	Maintain accurate employee records, contracts, and HR documentation
	Track staff attendance, shifts, leave, and overtime records
	Compile and analyses HR data related to staffing, performance, and turnover.


Recruitment & Onboarding Support:


	Support recruitment activities for restaurant staff roles
	Coordinate interviews, documentation, and onboarding processes
	Ensure smooth induction of new employees in line with BASL standards.


Performance Tracking & Reporting:


	Support the implementation of performance appraisal systems
	Monitor KPIs, productivity, and staff efficiency
	Prepare periodic HR reports for management and BASL.


Employee Relations & Compliance:


	Serve as a point of contact for employee HR-related inquiries
	Support disciplinary processes and documentation
	Ensure compliance with labour laws and internal HR policies.


Payroll & Compensation Support:


	Validate payroll inputs, including attendance, leave, and deductions
	Support timely salary processing in collaboration with accounts
	Maintain accurate records of compensation and benefits.


Training & Development Support:


	Coordinate staff training schedules and learning records
	Track training needs and participation
	Support skills development initiatives across departments.


Policy & Process Implementation:


	Implement HR policies, SOPs, and guidelines provided by BASL
	Ensure consistent application across all restaurant staff
	Support HR audits and process improvement initiatives.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
	2–4 years of HR experience, preferably in hospitality, food service, or service-driven organizations
	Strong administrative, analytical, and reporting skills
	Good knowledge of Nigerian labour laws
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and HR reporting tools
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Ability to work on-site in a fast-paced environment


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@brooksadvisoryservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail .

Deposit Mobilization Officer Job at Lendha




        
    

        
        Lendha is a quick money lending platform. We provide facility for emergency funds, house / office / shop rent and lifestyle loans.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Deposit Mobilization Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	Deposit Acquisition & Growth: Actively source and acquire new customers for deposit products (savings, fixed deposits).
	Client Relationship Management: Maintain relationships with new and existing clients to encourage loyalty and long-term deposits.
	Market Research & Analysis: Identify target market segments and track competitor deposit products.
	Product Knowledge & Education: Stay informed about the company’s deposit offerings and educate clients.
	Reporting & Compliance: Provide regular performance reports and ensure compliance with company policies.
	Cross-Selling: Promote additional products to customers and identify opportunities to upsell deposits.


Qualifications


	
	Minimum Educational Qualification: OND in Banking, Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
	


Experience:


	1-2 years in sales, customer service, or banking.
	Previous experience in deposit mobilization or handling customer accounts is an advantage.


Skills:
Strong sales & marketing skills to acquire new customers.


	Excellent communication skills (verbal and written).
	Customer service skills for relationship building.
	Strong attention to detail in account management.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and basic CRM tools.


Personal Attributes:


	Goal-oriented and able to meet targets.
	Self-motivated and proactive.
	Strong problem-solving skills to address customer concerns.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Why Join Us?


	Opportunity to work with a talented and passionate team.
	Work on exciting and challenging projects with the latest technologies.
	Flexible work environment.
	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	If you are passionate about clean code, testing, and scalable architectures, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and be part of a team that values quality and innovation.
